wikipedia_page.main: Arthur Sidney Mills (born 1906, date of death unknown) was an English professional footballer of the 1930s. Born in Karachi (then in India) in 1906, he joined Gillingham from Luton Town in 1933 and went on to make 33 appearances for the club in The Football League, scoring 12 goals. He left to join Burton Town in 1934.

response: * Arthur Mills (footballer, born 1906) (1906–?), English professional association football player of the 1930s
* Arthur Mills (Australian footballer) (1905–1984), Australian rules footballer
* Arthur Mills (MP) (1816–1898), British Conservative Party Member of Parliament for Taunton and Exeter
* Arthur Mills, 3rd Baron Hillingdon (1891–1952), British Member of Parliament for Uxbridge
* Arthur Mills (Indian Army officer) (1879–1964), general in the British Indian Army
